body.p: The nervous system releases chemicals termed __________,

response.feedback: Incorrect. "neuro" tells you that it is part of the nervous system.
Correct. Remember that neurotransmitters are faster acting than hormones but hormones often have a longer duration.

part.hint: The endocrine system releses these chemicals directly into the blood.

question.body: The gonads in the female are the ___________, while in the male they are in the___________?

response.feedback: Incorrect. The uterus and the penisare not considered gonads because they do not produce hormones.
Incorrect. The uterus is not a gonad, it does not produce hormones
Correct. The ovaries produce estrogen and progesterone while the testes produce testosterone.
Incorrect. The penis is not a gonad. It is part of the external genitalia of a male and does not produce hormones.

part.hint: Gonads are the organs that make sex hormones.

question.body: Shortly after you eat a meal your blood glucose levels ___________. This triggers the release of _____________ from your pancreas.

response.feedback: Incorrect. After a meal glucose enters the blood from the digestive system and your blood glucose levels increase.
Incorrect. If your blood glucose levels decreased your pancreas would release glucagon, however they only decrease when you skip a meal.
Incorrect. Blood glucose levels would increase but glucagon is released if blood glucose levels fall.
Correct. After eating the increase in blood glucose triggers the release of insuiln to move glucose into your cells and return blood glucose levels to normal

part.hint: When you eat nutrients are absorbed into the blood from the digestive tract.
